ColumnA: Site of EPTB Typical clinical presentation
TB of lymph nodes (TB lymphadenopathy) ( Common forms of EPTB )
ColumnB: Asymmetrical, painless, nontender lymph node enlargement (often >2 × 2 cm) for >1 month not responding to other treatment (e.g. antibiotics) With or without discharging sinus Most commonly cervical nodes [ a ]
ColumnC: CXR Ultrasound (if available) Fine-needle aspiration biopsy or excision biopsy with histology, Xpert MTB/RIF or Ultra, culture (if available) Respiratory specimens for Xpert MTB/RIF or Ultra

ColumnA: Pleural TB ( Common forms of EPTB )
ColumnB: Dullness on percussion and reduced breath sounds with or without pleuritic chest pain No acute illness
ColumnC: CXR Ultrasound (if available) TST/IGRA Pleural tap with biochemical analysis and cell counts, Xpert MTB/RIF or Ultra or culture (if available) [ b,c ] Respiratory specimens for Xpert MTB/RIF or Ultra

ColumnA: TBM ( Usually children aged <5 years with disseminated disease and severely ill )
ColumnB: Subacute onset (>5 days) of headache, irritability or abnormal behaviour, vomiting (without diarrhoea), lethargy, reduced level of consciousness, convulsions, neck stiffness, bulging fontanelle, cranial nerve palsies
ColumnC: CXR Lumbar puncture with biochemical analysis and cell counts and Xpert MTB/RIF or Ultra (rather than culture initially) completed on CSF [ b ] Brain imaging (if available) Respiratory specimens for Xpert MTB/RIF or Ultra TST/IGRA

ColumnA: Miliary TB [ d ] ( Usually children aged <5 years with disseminated disease and severely ill )
ColumnB: Nonspecific symptoms with persistent fever, lethargy and wasting
ColumnC: CXR (typical miliary pattern) Respiratory specimens for Xpert MTB/RIF or Ultra Lumbar puncture with biochemical analysis and cell counts and Xpert MTB/RIF or Ultra on CSF to exclude TBM [ b ] TST/IGRA

ColumnA: Abdominal TB ( Usually children aged ≥5 years )
ColumnB: Abdominal swelling with ascites or abdominal masses No acute illness
ColumnC: CXR Abdominal ultrasound Ascitic tap with biochemical analysis and cell counts, Xpert MTB/RIF, Xpert Ultra, or culture (if available) [ b ] Respiratory specimens for Xpert MTB/RIF or Ultra

ColumnA: Spinal TB ( Usually children aged ≥5 years )
ColumnB: Deformity of spine, narrow-angle kyphosis (gibbus) May have lower-limb weakness, paralysis, or loss of bowel or bladder control
ColumnC: X-ray spine Fine-needle aspiration biopsy or excision biopsy with histology and Xpert MTB/RIF, Ultra or culture (if available)

ColumnA: Pericardial TB ( Usually children aged ≥5 years )
ColumnB: Cardiac failure Distant or muffled heart sounds Apex beat difficult to palpate
ColumnC: CXR Cardiac ultrasound Pericardial tap with Xpert MTB/ RIF, Xpert Ultra or culture (if available) [ b ] Respiratory specimens for Xpert MTB/RIF or Ultra

ColumnA: TB bone and joint ( Usually children aged ≥5 years )
ColumnB: Limitation of movement and abnormal gait Unilateral joint effusion (usually knee or hip) Swelling at end of long bones or small hand bones (dactylitis)
ColumnC: Radiograph of joint or bone Joint tap or synovial biopsy, microscopy, Xpert MTB/ RIF, Xpert Ultra or culture (if available) [ b ] Respiratory specimens for Xpert MTB/RIF or Ultra
